CV DATA VIZ NET_ART VIDEO RESEARCH VGA READER

CV

  • Tiffany Funk is co-founding Lecturer and Academic Advisor of Interdisciplinary Education in the Arts (IDEAS) at the University of Illinois at Chicago, School of Art and Art History, and Editor-in-Chief of the Video Game Art Reader.
    • [full cv]

    EDUCATION

  • PhD 2016 University of Illinois at Chicago, Art History
    MFA 2012 University of Illinois at Chicago, New Media Arts
    MA 2005 University of Chicago, Humanities
    BA 2003 University of Wisconsin–Madison

    • SELECTED PUBLICATIONS

  • Book Chapters "Dirty Your Media: Artists’ Experiments in Digital Bio-Sovereignty," chapter in The Aesthetics of Necropolitics, ed. Natasha Lushetich (London: Rowman and Littlefield, 2018), forthcoming.
    Articles “’A MUSICAL SUITE COMPOSED BY AN ELECTRONIC BRAIN’: Reexamining the Illiac Suite and the Legacy of Lejaren A. Hiller Jr. in Conceptual Art,” Leonardo Music Journal, 28 (December 2018), forthcoming.

    “Would You Like to Play a Game?” The Video Game Art Reader, 1:1 (Fall 2017).

    "The Prosthetic Aesthetic: An Art of Anxious Extensions," Mid-America College Art Association Conference 2012 Digital Publications (2012).
    Catalogues Editor, Chicago New Media 1973-1992 exhibition catalog (Champaign-Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 2018), forthcoming.

    “Magic, the Future, and Code: Casting Coding within the Prosthetic Relationship,” Art2Code Catalogue, College Art Association and v1b3 (Winter 2016).

    “The Man Who Pictured Space from His Apartment—A performance piece by Cupola Bobber,” Cue Art Foundation exhibition catalogue, 2007.
    Interviews “‘Scale’: The Sound of Interspecies Communication? Tiffany Funk interviews Marlena Novak," Antennae: The Journal of Nature in Visual Culture 28 (Summer 2014): 50-59.

    • RECENT CONFERENCES / PANELS / WORKSHOPS

  • 2017 College Art Association Annual Conference, New York, NY; title of paper: “Just Press ‘PLAY’: ‘Real-time Computation’ (RTC) and ‘Simultaneity’ in Digital Art”

    Video Game Art Reader Panel, Harold Washington Public Library, Chicago IL

    Society for Literature, Science, and the Arts Annual Conference, Tempe, AZ; title of paper: “Panic! at the University of Illinois: Lejaren Hiller’s Illiac Suite (1956) and its Legacy in Time, Labor, and Art”

    ChiDM Presents, Chicago Design Museum; “Video Game Levels as works of Art, Architecture, and Design: Tiffany Funk and Chris Totten in Conversation”
    2016 Mid-America College Art Association Conference, University of Cincinnati, Cincinnati OH; title of paper: “‘Command-line Bullshittery,’ the Myth of Computer Literacy, and the 4th Dimension: Towards a Performative Pedagogical Foundation of Time-Based Media Arts”
    2014 14th Biennial Arts and Technology Symposium, The Ammerman Center for Arts and Technology, Connecticut College, New London, CT; title of paper: “Art as a Form of Behaviour: John Cage and Lejaren Hiller’s HPSCHD (1968-9) and the Potential of Agonistic Space in Software Art”
    2013 Panel member: The Sci-Fi Effect, Design Cloud Gallery, Chicago IL
    2012 Mid-America College Art Association Conference, Wayne State University, Detroit MI; title of paper: “Prosthetic Aesthetics”

    Processing Chicago, Electronic Visualization Lab, University of Illinois at Chicago; title of paper: “Wearable EMF sensing”
    2011 Critical Information Conference, School of the Visual Arts, New York NY; title of paper: "The Prosthetic Aesthetic: An Art of Anxious Extensions"

    • EDITORIAL EXPERIENCE / PEER-REVIEW

  • 2016-present Editor-in-Chief, Video Game Art Reader, VGA Gallery, Chicago IL

    2015–present Associate Editor, Media-N Journal, New Media Caucus: A College Art Association Affiliate Society
    2014–2017 Managing Editor of CAA Conference Editions, Media-N Journal, New Media Caucus: A College Art Association Affiliate Society
